reviews.review:
so what can i say about this heap of shit movie that hasn't already been said, but hey, i gotta get my feeling out about this.
where to begin, i guess ill start with the overall concept, its dumb, and was a really bad excuse to make a movie and i really cant do justice to just how bad it is.
the characters: the characters are more one dimensional than a piece of paper, they get ZERO character development, whatsoever. i was expecting to see a bit of character development at the beginning so that we could try to care for the characters, but nothing, we were just shown the main characters and then thrown into the movie with nothing. i feel the whole thing was very rushed, and its like "hey, here are the main characters, got it? no? oh well lets go" and then the bulk of the movie begins.
the "comedy": being 17, and as this movie is aimed at prepubescent children, i didn't expect anything, and even i was disappointed at just how bad the "jokes" were. there was a cringey pun every 2 minutes and for some reason there were a few uncomfortable adult jokes, that had no place in a movie like this, i mean, i know they were probably thrown in for the adults, but i feel there were obvious enough for a child to notice them.
closing statement: now, i did go and see this knowing it was going to be bad, but i was blown away at how bad it really was, as i mentioned, the story was terrible and rushed, the characters were one dimensional, and it might just be the worst movie ive ever watched
1.5 hours of your life that you'll never get back ...
It was really bad and cringe was everywhere
Just awful.  After watching this dumpster fire I had the urge to destroy my country by voting for Bernie.
Very stupid and unentertaining movie... the jokes were terrible and no story what so ever.
Great movie got to watch my friend lose his soul and all his happiness because of this movie. 10/10 would take another friend through this torture.
Biggest waste of $50 Million dollars. would have been a better use for starving kids in africa. Sony has hit a new low.

Without question, the Emoji Movie can be proclaimed "the best kid's movie of all time". With a colorful cast of characters, a good message, and very funny jokes, it looks like The Emoji Movie can take "Best Animated Feature" at the Oscars. Eat your heart out, Disney.
